author: chfast
content: Do you have a list of accounts (nonce=0, code='', non-empty storage)?

author: peter.davies
content: A Geth dev produced a list here: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/28666#issuecomment-1853397840

author: peter.davies
content:
I threw a script together that scanned my Reth node for them and finds the creation block. Output: https://pastebin.com/iKDEuxZC.

Seems like the newest one was created here https://etherscan.io/tx/0x1fae8c76e8e75c8919bb89b9cfb3dd973982f7c682f65a896a151160113d2e27 in block 982402.

author: samwilsn
content: <@425274498732916736> Hey! We're attempting to make our first official relase of EELS, but we need a new release of the ethash library on PyPI.

author: chfast
content: If just a release of what's in `master` I will try to handle this today (if I still have keys to pypi ðŸ¤ž)

author: peter.davies
content: Wheels would be nice since downstream people won't need to worry about C dependencies

author: samwilsn
content: Ah, right. Not a requirement, but would be nice.

author: chfast
content: <@689161464829050960> ethash has an old `setup.py` and I have trouble make it work with recent Python. Do you have time to take a look on this? https://github.com/chfast/ethash/pull/239

author: samwilsn
content: I can take a look in a few minutes :3

author: chfast
content: I guess I should read this: https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/discussions/setup-py-deprecated/

author: samwilsn
content: Yeah, python packaging has changed a ton. The old way still works though

author: chfast
content: The `python setup.py test` doesn't. But I think I can make it work with new commands...

author: samwilsn
content: Your pull request looks good as far as I can tell. I made a few tweaks in https://github.com/chfast/ethash/pull/241 but I don't think they're necessary.
